name: dyewood
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of wood from which dye (= colour) for cloth, etc. can be obtained: They filled the ship with fine-grained timber and dyewood. Old Fustic is a dyewood from India and Africa that produces a yellow dye.
More examplesFewer examplesA dyewood is any of a number of varieties of wood which provide dyes for textiles and other purposes.The basin of the Candelaria River, Campeche, Mexico, was at the heart of exploitation of dyewood and chicle in historic times.From 1504 onward, French vessels from Brittany, Flanders, and Normandy were active in the dyewood trade.
